page.title: 01 SOUTH-AYR GENERAL
page.content: During the {20th. Century }several private estates have been replaced by local authority or privately owned housing. Two estates remain as public parks -{Belleisle and Rozelle.}All that remains of{Castlehill Estate }is owned by Ayrshire and Arran Health Board who intend to build a hospital on the site. The soil was good for grazing and market gardening. There remain 4 farms and 3 nurseries. Local authority houses have been built on{The Mount}at Castlehill. From here you can see over the town of Ayr to the sea and the{Island of Arran.} Near the town are many mansion houses which are now used as hotels, boarding houses, a children's hospital, old people's homes and Wellington Private School.
